verses.verse: The vision <WH2377> of Isaiah <WH3470> the son <WH1121> of Amoz <WH531>, which he saw <WH2372> concerning Judah <WH3063> and Jerusalem <WH3389> in the days <WH3117> of Uzziah <WH5818>, Jotham <WH3147>, Ahaz <WH271>, and Hezekiah <WH3169>, kings <WH4428> of Judah <WH3063>.

Hear <WH8085>, O heavens <WH8064>, and give ear <WH238>, O earth <WH776>: for the LORD <WH3068> hath spoken <WH1696>, I have nourished <WH1431> and brought up <WH7311> children <WH1121>, and they have rebelled <WH6586> against me.
The ox <WH7794> knoweth <WH3045> his owner <WH7069>, and the ass <WH2543> his master's <WH1167> crib <WH18>: but Israel <WH3478> doth not know <WH3045>, my people <WH5971> doth not consider <WH995>.

Ah <WH1945> sinful <WH2398> nation <WH1471>, a people <WH5971> laden <WH3515> with iniquity <WH5771>, a seed <WH2233> of evildoers <WH7489>, children <WH1121> that are corrupters <WH7843>: they have forsaken <WH5800> <WH853> the LORD <WH3068>, they have provoked <WH5006> <WH853> the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel <WH3478> unto anger <WH5006>, they are gone away <WH2114> backward <WH268>. laden: Heb. of heaviness gone: Heb. alienated, or, separated

Why should ye be stricken <WH5221> any more? ye will revolt <WH5627> more and more <WH3254>: the whole head <WH7218> is sick <WH2483>, and the whole heart <WH3824> faint <WH1742>. revolt: Heb. increase revolt

From the sole <WH3709> of the foot <WH7272> even unto the head <WH7218> there is no soundness <WH4974> in it; but wounds <WH6482>, and bruises <WH2250>, and putrifying <WH2961> sores <WH4347>: they have not been closed <WH2115>, neither bound up <WH2280>, neither mollified <WH7401> with ointment <WH8081>. ointment: or, oil

Your country <WH776> is desolate <WH8077>, your cities <WH5892> are burned <WH8313> with fire <WH784>: your land <WH127>, strangers <WH2114> devour <WH398> it in your presence, and it is desolate <WH8077>, as overthrown <WH4114> by strangers <WH2114>. overthrown: Heb. the overthrow of
And the daughter <WH1323> of Zion <WH6726> is left <WH3498> as a cottage <WH5521> in a vineyard <WH3754>, as a lodge <WH4412> in a garden of cucumbers <WH4750>, as a besieged <WH5341> city <WH5892>.

Except <WH3884> the LORD <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> had left <WH3498> unto us a very small <WH4592> remnant <WH8300>, we should have been <WH1961> as Sodom <WH5467>, and we should have been like <WH1819> unto Gomorrah <WH6017>.
Hear <WH8085> the word <WH1697> of the LORD <WH3068>, ye rulers <WH7101> of Sodom <WH5467>; give ear <WH238> unto the law <WH8451> of our God <WH430>, ye people <WH5971> of Gomorrah <WH6017>.

To what <WH4100> purpose is the multitude <WH7230> of your sacrifices <WH2077> unto me? saith <WH559> the LORD <WH3068>: I am full <WH7646> of the burnt offerings <WH5930> of rams <WH352>, and the fat <WH2459> of fed beasts <WH4806>; and I delight <WH2654> not in the blood <WH1818> of bullocks <WH6499>, or of lambs <WH3532>, or of he goats <WH6260>. he goats: Heb. great he goats
When ye come <WH935> to appear <WH7200> before <WH6440> me, who hath required <WH1245> this at your hand <WH3027>, to tread <WH7429> my courts <WH2691>? to appear: Heb. to be seen

Bring <WH935> no more <WH3254> vain <WH7723> oblations <WH4503>; incense <WH7004> is an abomination <WH8441> unto me; the new moons <WH2320> and sabbaths <WH7676>, the calling <WH7121> of assemblies <WH4744>, I cannot away with <WH3201>; it is iniquity <WH205>, even the solemn meeting <WH6116>. iniquity: or, grief
Your new moons <WH2320> and your appointed feasts <WH4150> my soul <WH5315> hateth <WH8130>: they are a trouble <WH2960> unto me; I am weary <WH3811> to bear <WH5375> them.

And when ye spread forth <WH6566> your hands <WH3709>, I will hide <WH5956> mine eyes <WH5869> from you: yea, when ye make many <WH7235> prayers <WH8605>, I will not hear <WH8085>: your hands <WH3027> are full <WH4390> of blood <WH1818>. make: Heb. multiply prayer blood: Heb. bloods
Wash <WH7364> you, make you clean <WH2135>; put away <WH5493> the evil <WH7455> of your doings <WH4611> from before <WH5048> mine eyes <WH5869>; cease <WH2308> to do evil <WH7489>;

Learn <WH3925> to do well <WH3190>; seek <WH1875> judgment <WH4941>, relieve <WH833> the oppressed <WH2541>, judge <WH8199> the fatherless <WH3490>, plead <WH7378> for the widow <WH490>. relieve: or, righten

Come now <WH3212>, and let us reason together <WH3198>, saith <WH559> the LORD <WH3068>: though your sins <WH2399> be as scarlet <WH8144>, they shall be as white <WH3835> as snow <WH7950>; though they be red <WH119> like crimson <WH8438>, they shall be as wool <WH6785>.
If ye be willing <WH14> and obedient <WH8085>, ye shall eat <WH398> the good <WH2898> of the land <WH776>:
But if ye refuse <WH3985> and rebel <WH4784>, ye shall be devoured <WH398> with the sword <WH2719>: for the mouth <WH6310> of the LORD <WH3068> hath spoken <WH1696> it.
How is the faithful <WH539> city <WH7151> become an harlot <WH2181>! it was full <WH4392> of judgment <WH4941>; righteousness <WH6664> lodged <WH3885> in it; but now murderers <WH7523>.
Thy silver <WH3701> is become dross <WH5509>, thy wine <WH5435> mixed <WH4107> with water <WH4325>:

Thy princes <WH8269> are rebellious <WH5637>, and companions <WH2270> of thieves <WH1590>: every one loveth <WH157> gifts <WH7810>, and followeth <WH7291> after rewards <WH8021>: they judge <WH8199> not the fatherless <WH3490>, neither doth the cause <WH7379> of the widow <WH490> come <WH935> unto them.

Therefore saith <WH5002> the Lord <WH113>, the LORD <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635>, the mighty One <WH46> of Israel <WH3478>, Ah <WH1945>, I will ease <WH5162> me of mine adversaries <WH6862>, and avenge <WH5358> me of mine enemies <WH341>:
And I will turn <WH7725> my hand <WH3027> upon thee, and purely <WH1253> purge away <WH6884> thy dross <WH5509>, and take away <WH5493> all thy tin <WH913>: purely: Heb. according to pureness

And I will restore <WH7725> thy judges <WH8199> as at the first <WH7223>, and thy counsellors <WH3289> as at the beginning <WH8462>: afterward <WH310> thou shalt be called <WH7121>, The city <WH5892> of righteousness <WH6664>, the faithful <WH539> city <WH7151>.
Zion <WH6726> shall be redeemed <WH6299> with judgment <WH4941>, and her converts <WH7725> with righteousness <WH6666>. her: or, they that return of her

And the destruction <WH7667> of the transgressors <WH6586> and of the sinners <WH2400> shall be together <WH3162>, and they that forsake <WH5800> the LORD <WH3068> shall be consumed <WH3615>. destruction: Heb. breaking
For they shall be ashamed <WH954> of the oaks <WH352> which ye have desired <WH2530>, and ye shall be confounded <WH2659> for the gardens <WH1593> that ye have chosen <WH977>.
For ye shall be as an oak <WH424> whose leaf <WH5929> fadeth <WH5034>, and as a garden <WH1593> that hath no water <WH4325>.

And the strong <WH2634> shall be as tow <WH5296>, and the maker <WH6467> of it as a spark <WH5213>, and they shall both <WH8147> burn <WH1197> together <WH3162>, and none shall quench <WH3518> them. maker: or, and his work
